com.advantech.bleeplib.utils

Class BLEUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.advantech.bleeplib.utils.BLEUtil

  • public class BLEUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    BLEUtil is a singleton class for basic bluetooth communication with Advantech EPD devices. This class provides customized functions for scanning nearby devices, making a connection with a device, opening LED lights, firmware upgrading, and pushing image on the EPD device screen. Handshake protocol between Advantech EPD devices and the Android mobile has been well-defined based on Android Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) APIs. In this class, we only allow four device connections at a time and other devices will be in the waiting queue temporarily. After a device is disconnected, we will pull a device from the waiting queue to continue to make the connection. Note: Because each Android device has the maximum connection limitations for concurrent device connections, please remember to disconnect EPD devices if no necessary to use them.
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Fabian Chung

      • initial

        public boolean initial(android.content.Context context)
        Initialization for Android bluetooth resources and utilities in Activity. This step must be implemented in the beginning of your program.
        Parameters:
        context - the context of Android activity
        Returns:
        true if Android device has bluetooth service and initialize successfully; false otherwise

      • startScan

        public boolean startScan(int scanTime)
        Start a scan searching for nearby devices through BLE. Please remember to register scan listener before start a scan.
        Parameters:
        scanTime - -1 start a scan without stop; number start a scan for a limited time (unit: seconds)
        Returns:
        true if start a scan successfully; false already started
        See Also:
        addScanListener(BLEScanListener)

      • stopScan

        public void stopScan()
        Stop a scan.

      • connect

        public boolean connect(java.lang.String address)
        Make a connection with a device using the mac address. Please remember to register connection listener before make a connection.
        Parameters:
        address - device mac address
        Returns:
        true if connect a device successfully (Note: it's possible to stay in the waiting queue temporarily if reach the four maximum connections limit); false if connection exists or already in the waiting queue, we will return false
        See Also:
        addConnectListener(String, BLEConnectListener)

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect(java.lang.String address)
        Disconnect a device using the mac address.
        Parameters:
        address - device mac address

      • reconnect

        public void reconnect(java.lang.String address)
        Reconnect a device using the mac address. This function will force to disconnect the device if the connection has been existed.
        Parameters:
        address - device mac address

        address - device mac address
        Returns:

      • readFirmware

        public boolean readFirmware(java.lang.String mac)
        Read firmware version for a device. Firmware read result returns in the connection listener.
        Parameters:
        mac - device mac address
        Returns:
        true the command was send successfully; false device has not been connected or read characteristic failure
        See Also:
        BLEConnectListener.onFirmwareRead(int, byte[])

        Returns:

      • changeConnectionPriority

        public boolean changeConnectionPriority(java.lang.String mac,
                                        int priority)
        Change BLE connection priority for a device.
        Parameters:
        mac - device mac address
        priority - Request a specific connection priority. Must be one of BluetoothGatt.CONNECTION_PRIORITY_BALANCED, BluetoothGatt.CONNECTION_PRIORITY_HIGH or BluetoothGatt.CONNECTION_PRIORITY_LOW_POWER.
        Returns:
        true the command was send successfully; false otherwise

      • writeLED

        public boolean writeLED(java.lang.String mac,
                        boolean led1,
                        boolean led2,
                        boolean led3)
        Open or close LED Lights for a device. Write LED Lights result will return in the connection listener.
        Parameters:
        mac - device mac address
        led1 - open true or close false the LED light 1
        led2 - open true or close false the LED light 2
        led3 - open true or close false the LED light 3
        Returns:
        true the command was send successfully; false device has not been connected or write characteristic failure
        See Also:
        BLEConnectListener.onLEDWrite(int, byte[])

      • pushImage

        public boolean pushImage(java.lang.String mac,
                         PanelType panelType,
                         android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap,
                         int image_page,
                         int image_action)
        Push image to the EPD device.
        Parameters:
        mac - device mac address
        panelType - EPD panel-type PanelType
        bitmap - image in the bitmap format which is ready to transmit; please resize image size to fit each EPD panel-type PanelType
        image_page - which page number you want to transmit image on the EPD device; this number must be larger than 0
        image_action - refresh this image immediately 1 or not 0
        Returns:
        true send this command successfully; false device is not connected or an existing task is still running

        Parameters:
        mac - device mac address
        packageData - package data in the byte array format
        Returns:
        true send this command successfully; false device is not connected or an existing task is still running
